intro: Ursinia abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian ursinia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by pale green bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Ursinia abyssinica is often found in rocky soils and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
